item.title: What is causing this problem? EDIT: fixed
item.dc:creator: @Texasmd91 Texasmd91
item.description:
@Texasmd91 wrote:

[quote=“Palidino76, post:14, topic:83129”]try :

[code]
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0) {
int GambleCash = 1000;
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)==false) {
sendMessage(“You need at least “+GambleCash+” to play!”);
}
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)==true) {
double RandomGamble = Math.random();
int GambleReturnCash = (int)(((GambleCash * 1.5) - (GambleCash / 2) + 1) * RandomGamble) + (GambleCash / 2);

		if (RandomGamble >= .5) {
			GambleReturnCash = GambleReturnCash + 1;
		}
		
		sendMessage("You gamble "+GambleCash+" and get "+GambleReturnCash+" back.");
		deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), GambleCash);
		addItem(995, GambleReturnCash);
		actionTimer = 20;
	}
}

}
[/code][/quote]
didnt work, but Anz’s worked. thnx Azn!

item.title: What is causing this problem? EDIT: fixed
item.dc:creator: @Palidino76 Palidino76
item.description:
@Palidino76 wrote:

try :

if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { 
	if(actionTimer == 0) {	
		int GambleCash = 1000;
		if(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)==false) {
		sendMessage("You need at least "+GambleCash+" to play!");
		}
		if(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)==true) {
			double RandomGamble = Math.random(); 
			int GambleReturnCash = (int)(((GambleCash * 1.5) - (GambleCash / 2) + 1) * RandomGamble) + (GambleCash / 2);

			if (RandomGamble >= .5) {
				GambleReturnCash = GambleReturnCash + 1;
			}
			
			sendMessage("You gamble "+GambleCash+" and get "+GambleReturnCash+" back.");
			deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), GambleCash);
			addItem(995, GambleReturnCash);
			actionTimer = 20;
		}
	}
}

item.title: What is causing this problem? EDIT: fixed
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Yeh, hold up. Keep your eyes on this post as I fetch my tutorial.
Edit:

Purpose: playerHasItemAmount

Difficulty: Easy

Assumed Knowledge: Copy and Paste

Server Base: PimpScape - I used a default PimpScape.

Classes Modified: Client.Java

Procedure

Step 1:
Open your Client.Java.

Step 2:
Search for:

public boolean playerHasItemAmount(int itemID, int itemAmount) { //if(itemID == 0 || itemAmount == 0) return true; playerItemAmountCount = 0; for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) { if (playerItems[i] == itemID+1) { playerItemAmountCount = playerItemsN[i]; } if(playerItemAmountCount >= itemAmount){ return true;} } //return (itemAmount <= playerItemAmountCount); return true; }

Step 3:
Replace with mines:

public boolean playerHasItemAmount(int itemID, int itemAmount) { //if(itemID == 0 || itemAmount == 0) return true; playerItemAmountCount = 0; for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) { if (playerItems[i] == itemID+1) { playerItemAmountCount = playerItemsN[i]; } if(playerItemAmountCount >= itemAmount){ return true;} } //return (itemAmount <= playerItemAmountCount); return false; }

Credits: Azn.

Read full topic
item.source: What is causing this problem? EDIT: fixed

item.title: What is causing this problem? EDIT: fixed
item.dc:creator: @Texasmd91 Texasmd91
item.description:
@Texasmd91 wrote:

some 1 on another forum found how to fix, you just put (int) in front of what ever you want.
how ever it trims the double so it never rounds up, so i added the if random >= .5 then add 1 to the return

I now have another problem.
here is my new code

[code]if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0) {
int GambleCash = 1000;
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)) {
double RandomGamble = Math.random();
int GambleReturnCash = (int)(((GambleCash * 1.5) - (GambleCash / 2) + 1) * RandomGamble) + (GambleCash / 2);

		if (RandomGamble >= .5) {
			GambleReturnCash = GambleReturnCash + 1;
		}
		
		sendMessage("You gamble "+GambleCash+" and get "+GambleReturnCash+" back.");
		deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), GambleCash);
		addItem(995, GambleReturnCash);
		actionTimer = 20;
	} else {
		sendMessage("You do not have enough gold to do this!");
	}
}

}[/code]
It all works out but even if it doesnt have how much they gambled it still does it.

(ie: person has no gold but it still does it)

so am i using (playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)) wrong?

(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash))
that means if the player has the item 0995 (gold) and the amount is the variable of GambleCash right?

I have also tried (playerHasItemAmount(995, 1000)) to see if its because of the variable, but nope still does it…

Read full topic

item.title: What is causing this problem? EDIT: fixed
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Replace all your code with:

[code]if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { //Not sure if this works for all objects or just the door above, just forget this line
if(actionTimer == 0) {
int GambleCash = 1000; //Will remove this and make it where you enter how much you want to gamble after i fix the compile error
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, GambleCash)) {
double RandomGamble = Math.random(); //returns a number 0 to 1
int GambleReturnCash = Int(((GambleCash * 1.5) - (GambleCash / 2) + 1) * RandomGamble) + (GambleCash / 2); /makes GambleReturnCash = (a value from (GambleCash / 2) to (CambleCash * 1.5)/
sendMessage(“You gamble “+GambleCash+” and get “+GambleReturnCash+” back.”);

		deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), GambleCash);
		addItem(995, GambleReturnCash);
		actionTimer = 20;
	}
}

}[/code]

It’ll fix all the errors
